intro: Otostegia bucharica, commonly known as the Bucharic sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to arid environments, allowing it to store water efficiently. Otostegia bucharica is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to dry, temperate climates.
